common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers UI/UX Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces for Developers UI, including unresponsive demo chats after skipping onboarding, mysterious icons appearing when resizing the right tray in Obsidian, and onboarding screen elements being cut off on smaller screens. Solutions involve ensuring onboarding can be skipped without issues, investigating and resolving icon display glitches, and making the onboarding window resizable.

related_issues.title: [Obsidian]
related_issues.text:
[Obsidian]
### Software

Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When resizing the right tray, two mysterious icons appear in upper left and lower right

Occurs in both Copilot and Snippets tabs

Confirmed this only happens when Pieces is active in the right tray, not when other plugins are active in the right tray.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/830457d3-4dfc-44fa-a0dc-3f50ab7ea906


Obsidian version 
1.7.7

System
```
Model Name: MacBook Pro
Model Identifier: MacBookPro18,2
Chip: Apple M1 Max
Total Number of Cores: 10 (8 performance and 2 efficiency)
Memory: 64 GB
System Firmware Version: 10151.101.3
OS Loader Version: 10151.101.3
```






## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Unidentified video issue in Pieces for Developers Obsidian Plugin (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/345)

**Key Points:**

* @claire-at-pieces reported an unidentified video issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate team.
* Three related issues were suggested for reference.
* Helpful resources were provided.

**Problems Identified:**

* @claire-at-pieces experienced an unidentified video issue.
* The video content was not described.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mason-at-pieces suggested that the issue might be related to the two icons appearing in the corner of the copilot.
* @claire-at-pieces confirmed that the explanation resolved the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved.
* @claire-at-pieces confirmed the solution.

**Additional Notes:**

* The nature of the video issue remains unclear.
* The conversation indicates that the issue might be related to a known feature rather than a bug.

related_issues.title: Demo Chat are stuck loading
related_issues.text:
Demo Chat are stuck loading
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I set up a demo instance of pieces in a VM to test a bug report, for that purpose I skipped the onboarding completely, since then the demo chats are loading:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4c5b430-b6ad-4a90-a256-b410fcae09e5)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041156/log-12062024.txt)
PfD: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041159/log-12062024.txt)

pieces are loaded and annotated correctly:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbba8dfd-5872-4ee4-a9e3-31a9a55f0518)

##  Summary of Github Conversation on Chat Issues

**Key Points:**

* User (@hra42) reported chat history being wiped after restarting pOS and PfD. 
* User provided screenshots showing empty chat history and expected chat functionality. 
* Support team member (@mack-at-pieces) acknowledged the issue and requested additional details on the VM setup for investigation.
* User provided information about their macOS VM setup using Parallels on their MBP 2023. 
* As of the conversation recorded, the investigation is ongoing.

related_issues.title: Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
related_issues.text:
Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.2.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After installing, I get a screen to personalize my experience, but there's no way to continue after that:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa336e7-b02d-4b6c-8bcc-899cd4dc9679)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** 

* Pieces' onboarding interface cannot be resized when using smaller screen laptops like the Macbook Air 11 inch, causing off-screen content and making it difficult to progress.

**Solutions:**

* **Implemented:** Resize functionality added to the onboarding window in the next release.
* **Proposed:** Sharing system display size and resolution to aid in further resolution.

**Current Status:**

* The issue has been identified as a duplicate of #470.
* Onboarding window resizing will be available in the next Pieces release.
* Sharing display size and resolution will help developers address the issue more effectively.

**Key Points:**

* The issue presents a significant accessibility barrier for users with smaller screens.
* The Pieces team is actively addressing the problem and aiming to resolve it in the next release.
* Users are encouraged to share their system display size and resolution to contribute to the solution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Extension Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Pieces OS and its VS Code extension, including failure to launch, unresponsiveness, and processing errors.  Solutions include updating to the latest Pieces OS and extension versions, checking log files for errors, and ensuring Pieces OS is running.  Some issues are persistent and under investigation by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Andrea3i reported that the OS toolbar was not launching when trying to launch it in various ways: from VS, desktop app, OS app itself, restarting computer, etc.
* sam-p-at-pieces and Andrea3i shared Sentry issue links which indicated that the toolbar was failing to launch.

**Problems identified:**

* The toolbar was not launching properly.
* Automatic launch on startup was not working.
* Pieces OS was restarting on its own.
* Applet functionality was experiencing issues.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Hotfix for VS plugin version 3.0.1 was released to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 was released with changes to port selection for webview integrations.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue with the toolbar not launching may be resolved with the updated VS plugin and Pieces OS versions.
* However, Andrea3i still reported issues with the toolbar icon not working and Pieces OS restarting on its own.
* Debugging session is scheduled to further investigate the remaining issues.
* The Dart language sdk is being investigated to potentially identify the root cause of the applet functionality problem.

**Possible problems:**

* Lack of IPv6 support
* Firewall restrictions
* Account permission restrictions or Group policy restrictions

**Next steps:**

* Debugging session to identify the cause of the remaining issues.
* Investigating the Dart language sdk to determine the root cause of the applet functionality problem.
* Implementing a solution based on the findings of the investigation.

related_issues.title: Something went wrong with processing
related_issues.text:
Something went wrong with processing
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS 10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Any answer gives an error. This problem is the second day.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e237c726-ab1e-4c81-9c2e-706b2aee0675)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User "@AndreyPLtn" reported an issue with unhandled exceptions and processing errors in Pieces OS and Visual Studio Extension.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the relevant Pieces team member.
* The user was suggested to review similar issues and helpful resources.
* Support representative "@mark-at-pieces" identified the issue as a duplicate of another reported issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Unhandled exceptions and processing errors were occurring in Pieces OS and Visual Studio Extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user was directed to a different issue (#471) for resolution.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was identified as a duplicate and closed. The user is expected to follow the steps outlined in the referenced issue (#471) for resolution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Onboarding and Chat Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS onboarding process, including snippets and demo chats not generating, and chat history being wiped after restart.  This appears to be related to permission errors when calling GPT Inference Service.  Solutions include fixing access permissions and potential fixes in future Pieces OS releases.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points:

* User hra42 reported an issue with onboarding snippets and conversations not being generated.
* The root cause was identified as a PERMISSION_DENIED error when calling the GPT Inference Service.

### Solutions:

* The issue was likely resolved by fixing the access permissions for the GPT Inference Service.
* Additional details on the solution are not provided in the conversation excerpt.

### Current Status:

* The conversation ends with the identification of the error and possible solution.
* It's unclear whether the solution was implemented and if the issue was fully resolved.

### Additional Notes:

* The conversation took place on December 7th and 9th, 2024.
* The user was an existing Pieces user and followed specific steps for onboarding.
* The author mack-at-pieces is likely a member of the Pieces support team.

related_issues.title: PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
related_issues.text:
PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

On first use of PFD v. 3.2.4 after completing the install wizard, I get a "Context exceeded" error with a short message to copilot in empty chat using (using default model `Claude Sonnet 3.5`) 

Repro 
1. fresh install of PDF on MacOS
2. complete wizard with defaults
3. in chat opened on load, ask default model Claude Sonnet 3.5 "Yo world"

May be related to #487 , but creating separate issue as it relates to onboarding

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/481c3e22-5e84-436d-b81a-4f8bfdc88083

## Issues raised 
* **Problem:** The issue reported by Claire involves Copilot not functioning properly (details unclear from this conversation).

## Key points 

* The issue has been triaged to the relevant Pieces team member for investigation. 
* Mark, a member of the Pieces team, identifies this issue as a duplicate of **https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/487**.
* This issue will be addressed in the next PiecesOS release.

## Solutions 

* Pieces team is aware and working on a fix.
* No immediate workaround mentioned. 

## Status & Outcome 
* Issue marked as a duplicate.
* Resolution expected in next PiecesOS release.

**Additional Information**
* Links to related issues and helpful resources provided by the bot.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various bugs with the Pieces Desktop application, including scrolling issues in chat, processing errors, and demo chat loading failures.  Suggested solutions include checking for duplicate issues, providing detailed bug reports, and contacting support. The Pieces team is actively investigating and addressing these issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

2.12.2

### Early Access Program

- [X] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When answering, the curser stays with the question, should move to the answer. Requires clicking the arrow-down symbol to the end and then fine-navigating to the begin of the answer.
## Conversation Summary: Scrolling behavior in Pieces copilot

**Key points**:

* Users desire better control over scrolling behavior while messages are streaming in.
* Specific needs include:
    * Jumping to the top/bottom of individual answers.
    * Distinguishing between similar answers during prompt refinement.
    * Maintaining scroll position while the response is being generated.
    * Automatic scrolling down by default.
* Potential solutions discussed:
    * Implementing a running index for answer differentiation.
    * Adopting a two-pane approach for easier navigation.
    * Adjusting scrolling behavior based on user input.

**Current status**:

* Improvements have been pushed out, but some users still experience issues.
* Further investigation and potential updates are expected.

**Action items**:

* Users are encouraged to report any ongoing scrolling issues and provide feedback on the latest version.
* The development team will continue working on refining the scrolling behavior based on user needs.

 **please fix this issue**

Thank You 
### pieces information

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** User (@Kiran-Jadhav200) reported an error encountered with the Pieces app ("Something went wrong with processing").

* User experienced an error message indicating a processing error within the app.
* The issue was identified as a potential duplicate of another reported issue (#471).

**Problems Identified:**

* The app encountered an error while processing user input.
* The specific cause of the error was not immediately identified.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @hra42 suggested following the steps outlined in #471.
* @mark-at-pieces requested further information from the user to diagnose the issue.
* The issue was closed due to its potential duplicate status.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed pending further information from the user.
* The outcome of the investigation is unknown.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was advised to reach out to mark@pieces.app for further assistance.
* The conversation highlights the importance of providing detailed information when reporting issues.

common_issues.title: Firefox Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Firefox integration on Pieces OS, particularly on Windows.  Issues include Firefox not launching correctly from Pieces OS, conflicts with existing Firefox instances, and errors when opening links.  Potential solutions involve ensuring Firefox runs as an independent process and addressing conflicts with Pieces OS services.

related_issues.title: "Open Copilot in browser" causes error with Firefox
related_issues.text:
"Open Copilot in browser" causes error with Firefox
### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When trying to open `Pieces` in a browser while using `Firefox` as the default system browser and an instance of `Firefox` is already opened, this error appears (sorry, the text is in Slovenian):
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2f468ead-57ff-400c-a076-e97f429b26d0)
It's the standard error `Firefox is already running but is not communicating ...` with the `Close Firefox` and `Cancel` options. Clicking `Close Firefox` closes the error dialog, but after a few seconds it reappears again.

If all instances of `Firefox` are closed and the button is clicked, then it works.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Point:** Users are experiencing an error when trying to connect with GitHub through Pieces on Windows 10 using Firefox.

**Problem:** The issue seems specific to Firefox on Windows 10. No information is provided about the error message or specific steps causing the error.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions are proposed or implemented in the conversation excerpt provided.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved and requires further investigation.
* Additional information is needed to diagnose the problem, such as the error message and steps to reproduce it.

**Further Action:**

* Gather more details about the error, including screenshots and specific steps to reproduce.
* Investigate whether the issue occurs in other browsers on Windows 10 or other operating systems.
* Look for existing bug reports or discussions about similar issues with Pieces and GitHub integration.

## Conclusion

While the conversation highlights a user experiencing an error, more information is needed to diagnose and resolve the problem. Following the suggested further actions will help to investigate the issue and find a solution.

related_issues.title: FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
related_issues.text:
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Clicking on any link within the Pieces desktop app that required a browser to open up, I would receive the message:
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window.
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/706ac8c5-b939-4183-af48-ba573901f6ba)

After further review, it does appear that all instances of firefox are spawned under the Pieces OS service:
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/716495d0-b4aa-4bfa-b8d4-d0baf32c8984)

I know that disabling the WorkStream Pattern Engine, this is not an issue. (Assuming I kill off all processes of firefox under that task).


It makes me think that since Pieces OS is hijacking the process, and then firefox is trying to spawn the instance outside of that process, there is a conflict.


My default browser is set to firefox.

I'm running W11.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Firefox instances spawned by the OS App are treated as nested processes, causing conflicts.
* Issue only occurs within the "Pieces for Developers" app.
* Triggering Firefox to load a URL results in it being loaded as a nested process under the application.
* Occurs on Windows 11, regardless of insider preview status.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firefox instances are not being treated as independent processes.
* This behavior is causing conflicts with the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Investigating the cause of the problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No solution has been implemented yet.
* The problem seems to be related to Windows Insider Preview builds, but also occurs on non-preview builds.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user has provided screenshots to illustrate the issue.
* The user is not using an insider preview build.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Andrea3i reported that the OS toolbar was not launching when trying to launch it in various ways: from VS, desktop app, OS app itself, restarting computer, etc.
* sam-p-at-pieces and Andrea3i shared Sentry issue links which indicated that the toolbar was failing to launch.

**Problems identified:**

* The toolbar was not launching properly.
* Automatic launch on startup was not working.
* Pieces OS was restarting on its own.
* Applet functionality was experiencing issues.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Hotfix for VS plugin version 3.0.1 was released to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 was released with changes to port selection for webview integrations.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue with the toolbar not launching may be resolved with the updated VS plugin and Pieces OS versions.
* However, Andrea3i still reported issues with the toolbar icon not working and Pieces OS restarting on its own.
* Debugging session is scheduled to further investigate the remaining issues.
* The Dart language sdk is being investigated to potentially identify the root cause of the applet functionality problem.

**Possible problems:**

* Lack of IPv6 support
* Firewall restrictions
* Account permission restrictions or Group policy restrictions

**Next steps:**

* Debugging session to identify the cause of the remaining issues.
* Investigating the Dart language sdk to determine the root cause of the applet functionality problem.
* Implementing a solution based on the findings of the investigation.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Firefox integration issues:** The data shows a recurring and unresolved issue with Firefox integration on Pieces OS, impacting user experience on Windows. Resolving this should be a priority.

**Investigate and address Pieces OS onboarding and chat problems:** Multiple users have reported issues with onboarding snippets, demo chats, and chat history. This seems linked to permission errors with the GPT Inference Service and requires immediate attention.

**Improve Pieces OS and VS Code extension stability:** Issues like Pieces OS getting stuck, VS extension not working, and processing errors point to stability concerns. Focus on identifying and resolving the root causes of these issues.
**Address Pieces for Developers UI/UX issues:** Users have reported specific UI/UX problems, such as unresponsive demo chats and display glitches. Prioritize these fixes to improve user experience.
**Review and update documentation for common issues:** Ensure that support documentation and FAQs address the common issues identified, including clear steps for troubleshooting and resolving them.

**Gather more detailed user feedback:** Encourage users to provide detailed bug reports, including system information, steps to reproduce the issue, and screenshots. This will aid in faster diagnosis and resolution.
**Consider a bug bash event:** Organize a focused bug bash event with internal teams to uncover and address the issues identified in the report and improve overall product quality.
